intro: Cynoglossum viridiflorum, commonly known as greenflower mouse-ear, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in late summer, producing a distinctive bell-shaped structure with five petals. The plant is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it serves as a nectar source for pollinators.
